node.text: this was one of the reasons I want to see a therapist, I thought I was the only one... I had a panic attack a couple days ago because of this, actually

"I'LL GIVE YOU SOMETHING TO CRY ABOUT" always got me as a kid. My parents would constantly use this to shut me up if I didn't they would break my things. My dad had anger issues (he's fixed them but trauma is trauma) he would constantly yell about little things break furniture, threaten me or my brother, get in our faces, all that fun stuff. It got the point were I was scared to tell him anything. Now anyone yelling at me good or bad gives me an anxiety attack and I start to cry. My brother started to show the same behavior more violent though. He would push my mom against the wall or grab her wrists, all the while yelling from both sides. My mom was a bit better but still pretty bad with it. Please please please no matter how mad don't let emotions get the best of you raising your voice a bit is ok but full on shouting is scary and could really hurt people.

i’ve always been TERRIFIED at men raising their voice at me or just giving me a slightly mad look, even with my male family members, my boss, my friends, it dosen’t matter. this is genuinely harrowing how common this is and i stand with each and every person who feels fear around intimidating others. -hannah 💛

It's "scrary" if it's loud, obviously, anything loud is scary and will at least make u flinch. Shit's lowkey hot too tho 💀(unless they're a actual threat)
I'm 19 and I still cry when I get yelled at. I never thought other women felt the same way.
@emityler 💯
@alisha_kitto
God I thought it was just me
I remember my fifth grade teacher yelling bloody murder at me for gluing stuff on my poster too early and it fucking terrified me

I’m already noise sensitive due to my sensory issues, so when people, especially men, start shouting it messes me up for the rest of the day. I remember, I was in like year six (5th grade) and my teacher yelled at a student nearby me so loud I screamed and fell off my chair. Shit hurts

@katamaribaby i am truly sorry if I invalidated you in any way. On another note, you do understand that the post says that women are basically raised to think that way? That men yelling at them makes them a bit more than uncomfortable. And if someone said, not every man, i agree, not every man would. But many do,some intentionaly, some not. And i agree that women are also fucking terrifing when they yell and get all in your space. No one should feel that way, regardless of gender, but i feel like men are less likely to be on the reciving end(correct me if I'm wrong). Also, arguments can get heated, but I believe that an argument  can be solved without yelling and getting up in someone's face.
@ivanella_queen yeah thats not the part im upset abt im more upset that people are using this as a way to say "fuck men" yanno
@katamaribaby yeah I agree with you on that one
yall rlly out here telling men not to be emotional.....
@chess.boi just saying that women are not the only ones affected by this, men are too
I’m a guy and this scares the ever living shit outta me. My dad yells a lot and I get horrified whenever my teacher yells and practically have a panic attack on the spot

I was sitting in my stepdad’s truck with one of his worker’s behind me the other day and a lady pulled out in front of him, and he got very loud and hit the roof of his truck and his steering wheel, and I started shaking. I’ve always been scared of men and some women yelling because my mom and some of her boyfriends have been extremely abusive towards me. It scared me and he just laughed off his anger, but I scooted over a little when he wasn’t looking. His employee laughed nervously too and tried to make me feel better but the whole way home I was extremely uncomfortable and scared.
@birds.right.activist commenter makes stupid comment because they're insensitive
Anon pisses her pants cause annoyed man raised his voice
It's a horrible thing
ever heard of abusive mothers?

I was always scared and always will be when men are raising their voices or being angry. I am scared that they are gonna punch me or something. I often get to the point where I am scared to move or do anything in that moment. Or I cry or have a panic attack. It all began with my father.
@ccchavez13 glad I am not the only one

Even my brother scares me when he yells and he is a year older than me. He basically gets completely mad at me if I don’t obey him so I have to keep quiet so my parents don’t get involved and it’s so annoying. It is like ‘can you get me a drink’ ‘no do it yourself’ ‘WHY NOT YOU ARE BEING SO SELFISH’. Sometimes when we were younger he hit me and even still I flinch every time he raises his hand. He knows it scares me and manipulated me because of it

This is why women have to raise their voice(s) twice as much the moment a man does...otherwise they have no idea how it feels. I hate sounding like a psycho as much as the next person (yelling when I can just talk normally) but hey, whatever it takes to get the point across.
Bruh I'm male and it scares me
@k_ces

You know, I have heard many men say that "we should get rid of that fear in women". They say that it's "not their fault" or whatever excuse. My fellow men, the only way to get this fear to disappear is to stop all the bad things we do first. This will give you the "miracle cure" that you want for this fear.
this was one of the reasons I want to see a therapist, I thought I was the only one... I had a panic attack a couple days ago because of this, actually
